column4: All: I am having a problem getting my Wireless working with a broadcom chipset of bcm43xx 4306
http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=185174&highlight=fwcutter+4306+edgy
tried that
BCM43xx wirless: Any suggestions?
tried fwcutter to no avail
ndiswrapper is not working well either
any really good guides/wiki's?
what did it say when you tried it?
nothing
What guide do you use for ndiswrapper?
i have bcm4306 on my powerbook and got it working
With what?
i didn't use ndiswrapper, i extracted from an apple file on osx
lilandra:  How did you install it?
My wireless light isn't even turning on
well there's a file on OSX, AppleAirport2 which has the firmware and i used fwcutter to extract the firmware and store it in /lib/firmware and then did a modprobe
Do you have a guide to that at all?
it's kinda sketchy...hold on
but i had the firmware in a file...not sure abot in windows
I'm pretty sure I know where to find driver in windows
http://lilandra.com/blog/archives/2006/08/02/wireless-on-powerbook-g4-with-airport-extreme-with-linux-instructions/
i also link to http://www.lanterntorch.com/free-software/149/airport-extreme-lives-in-linux/
and on gentoo: http://forums.gentoo.org/viewtopic-t-409194.html
but ty, somebody once said it works well for the 4306 and iffy on other 43xx
I have a 4306 bcm43xx
so it might work
okay! i hope so! instructions are a tad sketchy but i used the lanterntorch and gentoo to help me
doesn't seem to be working lilandra
what happens? :-(
lilandra: don't know where to get those drivers
Tried copying them from my windows files to no avail
when i installed edgy and reinstalled osx, i couldn't use the driver anymore and had to use the old version i saved
would my driver work? from apple?
Lilandra; you have a copy?
Maybe?
Worth a shot
hold on
lilandra: sudo bcm43xx-fwcutter -w /lib/firmware ~/Desktop/BCMWL5.INF
Extracting firmware from this file is IMPOSSIBLE. (e.g. too old/new)
there is the error
blake6489:  How is ak these days?
i got that alot too. and in fact the file i have gets some that is too old but some that is good
did u get my pm?
lilandra:  so which one do I use and where do I get it?
i used this: http://lilandra.com/wireless/AppleAirPort2
does it work?
doesnt look like it
does it not extract anything?
rebooting
ty?
when i installed ubuntu i said my hardware clock was set to local time and not UTC but i think it is set to UTC so how do i make ubuntu know that it is set to UTC now?
lilandra:  You still here?
yes
Lilandar: Sorry had a disconnect of brain
if i zipped up the stuff i extracted, would that work?
i had to reboot into xubuntu
Thats fine can you read me in pm's?
i don't think you get my pm's or i don't get yours...not sure how that works on freenode
I get yours
i'm not getting yours bu tok
got it?
Weird how should I run this?
oooo...do you have bzip2 and tar?
Yes these all extracted with when I ran those airports
lilandra: when I run sudo iwlist eth0 (My wireless) scan it does nothing
did u do the modprobe?
Sudo modprobe bcm43xx?
and did u get any error messages?
yes i think so
No error messages and I did run modprobe
dmesg?
were you able to bring eth0 up?
[ 4874.557136]  ADDRCONF(NETDEV_UP): eth0: link is not ready
yikes
now i think i'm lost :-(
haha ya
is this edgy?
lilandra:  My least favorite thing about linux
yes
i remember struggling a bit more with edgy but i cant remember why
hmm...
lilandra: you use ndiswrapper to any luck?
i didn't use ndiswrapper...not sure what to do with it
i'm beginning to think i was lucky
but the modprobe worked, so what does that mean
Sometimes it does just seem to be luck that gets these working:  Got skype working first time installed linux on my 64 bit processer...never got it to work again...
yikes!
any other suggestions?  I'm sick of trolling the forums...might be time to hook back up the usb dongle wireless
Just had high hopes that I wouldn't have to use it...its kinda inconvient
right now no, i can...err...boot into a live cd and work from scratch and see if i forgot anything...tomorrow...:-(
that is fine
I should go to be as well
bed
ok...my email is on my site. i will come back on tomorrow
'night
lilandra:  thanks for the help!
bye all
